alert.note: Alert for Grant; Morton; Sheridan; Sioux (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 05 at 1:22PM CDT until October 06 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM CDT /9 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds up to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...Grant, Morton, Sheridan, and Sioux Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 1 PM CDT /noon MDT/ Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from 10 PM CDT /9 PM MDT/ this evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Objects left unsecured outside will be blown around. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops and other sensitive vegetation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sub-freezing temperatures are also possible across all of western and central North Dakota Friday night into Saturday morning.
info.instruction: Use extra caution. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
